New Records: Kylian Mbappé scored his 19th goal in 19 international games
Key Match Events: Mbappé involved in all three of France's goals, including skinning Luxembourg's right-back and chipping the ball for Kolo Muani to head home, allowing space for Jonathan Clauss to hit a thunderous strike, and positioning himself on the penalty spot to round off France's 3-0 win and net his goal
Pre-Game Insights: Mbappé said he was 'happy' and that is bad news for France's Euro 2024 rivals, Mbappé feels the Euros is'more complicated' than a World Cup because of the competing teams' familiarity with one another, Mbappé is fully aware France have not won the competition for 24 years and will be taking the learnings from Euro 2020 into his fourth tournament this summer
Post-Match Reflections: Deschamps described Mbappé as a 'fantastic leader', Mbappé said the captaincy will not change him and he is as determined as ever to lead his country to victory, Deschamps was satisfied with Mbappé's performance, saying 'he knows why he's here and we're going to need him at his best'
Miscellaneous Highlights: Mbappé occupied a more central position rather than his preferred left wing on Wednesday, France manager Didier Deschamps likes the interchangeable positions of his attacking line and their interaction with Antoine Griezmann as it's less predictable for opponents, Mbappé was involved in a busy performance, making runs in behind, combining well with Griezmann and Theo Hernandez down the left
